article.p:
phosphorous acid (H
3
PO
3
)
, also called
orthophosphorous acid
, one of several oxygen acids of phosphorus, used as reducing agent in chemical analysis. It is a colourless or yellowish crystalline substance (melting point about 73° C, or 163° F) with a garliclike taste. An unstable compound that readily absorbs moisture, it is converted to phosphoric acid (H
3
PO
4
) in the presence of oxygen or when heated above 180 °C (360 °F). Phosphorous acid (H
3
PO
3
) forms salts called phosphites, also used as reducing agents. It is prepared by dissolving tetraphosphorus hexoxide (P
4
O
6
) or phosphorus trichloride (PCl
3
) in water.
